items.name: Ext.env.Ready
bind
items.text: Binds the appropriate browser event for checking if the DOM has loaded.

items.name: fireReady
items.text: This method starts the process of firing the ready event. This may be delayed based on the delay property.

items.name: handleReady
items.text: This method iterates over the listeners and invokes them. This advances the state from 1 to 2 and ensure the proper subset of listeners are invoked.

items.name: handleReadySoon
items.text: This method is called to schedule a call to handleReady using a `setTimeout`. It ensures that only one timer is pending.

items.name: delay
items.text: If passed, this overrides the delay property.

items.name: invoke
items.text: This method invokes the given `listener` instance based on its options.

items.name: invokeAll
items.text: Invokes as many listeners as are appropriate given the current state. This should only be called when DOM ready is achieved. The remaining business of blocks is handled here.

items.name: makeListener
items.text: This method wraps the given listener pieces in a proper object for the listeners array and invoke methods.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method to call.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the `fn` executes.
Defaults to the browser window.

items.name: options
items.text: An object with extra options.

items.name: delay
items.text: A number of milliseconds to delay.

items.name: priority
items.text:
Relative priority of this callback. A larger
number will result in the callback being sorted before the others.  Priorities
1000 or greater and -1000 or lesser are reserved for internal framework use only.

items.name: dom
items.text:
Pass `true` to only wait for DOM ready, `false`
means full Framework and DOM readiness.
The listener instance.

items.name: on
items.text:
Adds a listener to be notified when the document is ready (before onload and before
images are loaded).

items.name: fn
items.text: The method to call.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the `fn` executes.
Defaults to the browser window.

items.name: options
items.text: An object with extra options.

items.name: delay
items.text: A number of milliseconds to delay.

items.name: priority
items.text:
Relative priority of this callback. A larger
number will result in the callback being sorted before the others.  Priorities
1000 or greater and -1000 or lesser are reserved for internal framework use only.

items.name: dom
items.text:
Pass `true` to only wait for DOM ready, `false`
means full Framework and DOM readiness.

items.name: onReadyEvent
items.text:
This is a generic event handler method attached to all of the various events that
may indicate ready state. The first call to this method indicates ready state has
been achieved.

items.name: ev
items.text: The event instance.

items.name: sortFn
items.text: Sorts the listeners array by `phase` and `priority` such that the first listener to fire can be determined using `pop` on the listeners array.

items.name: unbind
items.text:
This method is called to remove all event listeners that may have been set up to
detect ready state.

items.name: pollScroll
items.text:
This strategy has minimal benefits for Sencha solutions that build
themselves (ie. minimal initial page markup). However, progressively-enhanced
pages (with image content and/or embedded frames) will benefit the most
from it. Browser timer resolution is too poor to ensure a doScroll check
more than once on a page loaded with minimal assets (the readystatechange
event 'complete' usually beats the doScroll timer on a 'lightly-loaded'
initial document).

items.name: onReadyStateChange
items.text: This event handler is called when the readyState changes.

items.name: blocks
items.text: The number of Framework readiness blocks.

items.name: bound
items.text:
This property stores the state of event listeners bound
to the document or window to detect ready state.

items.name: delay
items.text:
This allows the DOM listener thread to complete (usually desirable with mobWebkit,
Gecko) before firing the entire onReady chain (high stack load on Loader). For mobile
devices when running from Home Screen, the splash screen will not disappear until
all external resource requests finish. This delay clears the splash screen.

items.name: events
items.text:
An array of events that have triggered ready state. This
is for diagnostic purposes only and is only available in debug builds.
An array

items.name: firing
items.text:
This property is `true` when we currently calling the
listeners.

items.name: generation
items.text: A counter of the number of mutations of listeners.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The set of listeners waiting for ready.

items.name: nextId
items.text:
A counter so we can assign listeners an `id` to keep
them in FIFO order.

items.name: sortGeneration
items.text: A captured value of generation that indicates when the listeners were last sorted.

items.name: state
items.text: Holds the current ready state as managed by this class. The values possible are: * 0 - Not ready. * 1 - Ready detected but listeners are not yet notified. * 2 - Ready detected and listeners are notified. See also firing.

items.name: timer
items.text:
The handle from `setTimeout` for the delayed notification
of ready.

items.name: scrollTimer
items.text: Timer for doScroll polling
